summary: Set against the rugged backdrop of Alberta's Kananaskis Country, the Moose Mountain Trail Races offer a grueling mountain running experience through the Canadian Rockies' foothills. Participants navigate technical singletrack and steep fire roads, culminating in breathtaking panoramic views of the Elbow River Valley and the surrounding alpine peaks.
uniqueFeatures: The course features significant vertical gain that includes a demanding ascent toward the 2,437-meter summit of Moose Mountain, providing 360-degree views of the Front Range.
Runners tackle the highly technical 'Pneuma' trail, a local favorite known for its sustained climbing and intricate, root-filled terrain that tests agility and endurance.
The event showcases the diverse ecosystems of the West Bragg Creek trail system, transitioning from dense subalpine forests to exposed, rocky ridgelines.
